name: Sal
title: Minced and Moist - fine dinning version
content: So you have to eat a minced and moist diet because of dry mouth after radiation? This is for you: Creamy Dill Salmon. Mix lime juice, freshly chopped dill and sour cream with a fork. Cook fresh salmon in a pan with a little olive oil until flaky. Serve salmon with the dill cream sauce. Enjoy!

name: Lernantino
title: thickening liquids - that taste okay
content: If you have to drink mildly thick liquids, you know it doesn't taste good in water. Here are some ideas to stay hydrated with taste! Any juice makes it better but my preference is cranapple. Other options are finding naturally thicker liquids like smoothies or milkshakes. If you have to drink water, try adding a little lemon or lime juice. It's not perfect but it's better than nothing!

name: Amiko
title: Recipe for inpaired chewing!
content: Can't chew because of a tongue resection? Remember it's better if you moisten your food and try to place it further back in your mouth so it's easier to swallow. Here's a recipe for you: Creamy Chicken and Rice Soup. Cook chicken in a pan with a little olive oil until cooked through shred finely so it mixes easily with other ingredients and chewing is minimally necessary. Add chicken broth, rice, and cream cheese. Simmer until rice is cooked throughly and is easy to mash with a fork. Enjoy!
